intro: Adesmia tenuis, commonly known as the slender adesmia, is a small flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow flowers clustered in racemes. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Adesmia tenuis is often found in arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
